resources.string: We detected that Bluetooth is switched off. It should be enabled for tracking to work.
We detected that Wi-Fi is switched off. It should be enabled for tracking to work.
GPS disabled. Click the notification to enable GPS and grant permissions.
Location disabled. Click the notification and grant permissions.
Background Location disabled. Click the notification and grant permissions.
Activity Recognition disabled. Click the notification and grant permissions.
We has no GPS signal & Wi-Fi is switched off. Please enable Wi-Fi and enable Location access in Settings.
Your trips may not be recorded when battery saving mode is enabled
Please, allow this application to avoid system battery optimization for better performance
To collect accurate data and complete app operation, you need to resolve access to the following functions:
You haven’t granted this important permission. In order to score your trips all permission requests must be accepted. Please go to App settings to approve this permission.
You disabled important notification channel \"Tracker service\". In order to score your trips this channel must be enabled. Please go to App settings to enable this channel.
Then, you will receive a popup to grant rights to temporary store trips data in your phone storage.\n\n Please, choose Allow for application to temporary store trip data.

to
access photos, media,
and files on your
device?

As the next step, you will receive a popup to grant rights to access to location.

 The app uses your location data to automatically record your trips in background, determine when you have started and ended your trip and to measure your score.

 The app will not work without this permission.

 On the next popup, please select Allow.

As the next step, you should grant rights to access to location in background.

 The app uses your location data to automatically record your trips in background, determine when you have started and ended your trip and to measure your score.

 The app will not work without this permission.

 You should navigate to app settings and choose "Allow all the time on the Location permission screen.

string.name: wizard_telematics_location_additional_description
string.small: This app may want to access your location all the time, even when you\'re not using the app. Allow in settings.

resources.string:
Then, you will receive a popup to grant access to your physical activity. 
We need this information to create a driving score.

 Please, choose Allow for application to grant access to physical activity.
You will receive a popup shortly to turn on device location, which uses Google\'s location service.\n\n For the app to work properly choose OK
For a better experience, turn on device location, which uses Google\'s location service.
You will receive a popup shortly to ignore battery optimizations.\n\n For the app to work properly choose ALLOW

string.name: wizard_telematics_attention_dialog_battery
string.small:
Let app always run in background?

Allowing application to always run in the
background may reduce battery life.

You can change this later from
Settings > Apps & notifications.

resources.string: By press "Proceed" you will be forwarded to settings to setup power management.\n For the app to work properly DISABLE power management.
By press "Proceed" you will be forwarded to settings to setup AUTOSTART.\n For the app to work properly ENABLE autostart
By press "Proceed" you will be forwarded to settings to setup notifications.\n For the app to work properly ENABLE all notification.
Allow only while using the app

As the next step, you’ll see a popup to grant app access to location services.

 The app uses your location data to automatically record your trips in background, determine when you have started and ended your trip and to measure your score.

 The app will not work without this permission.

 On the next popup, please select Change to precise location.
As the next step, you will receive a popup to grant rights to access to Bluetooth.\n\n On the next popup, please select Allow.
to find, connect to, and determine the relative position of nearby devices?
